Ghoomer (lit. 'Spinner')[a] is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language sports drama film written and directed by R. Balki.[3] It stars Shabana Azmi, Abhishek Bachchan, Saiyami Kher, and Angad Bedi.[4]
The film had its World Premiere as the opening film at the 12th Indian Film Festival of Melbourne on 12 August 2023[5] and was released theatrically in India on 18 August 2023.[6][7][8] At 69th Filmfare Awards, the film received three nomination, including Best Actor (Critics) for Bachchan and Best Supporting Actress for Azmi.[9]


Synopsis[edit]
Anina "Ani" Dixit, a bright and upcoming batting prodigy, loses her right hand in a freak accident. However, the unsympathetic and failed test cricketer, Padam "Paddy" Singh Sodhi, gives her new hope in the form of bowling. He trains her with unconventional techniques, to turn her fate around as a bowler. Spinning or "Ghoomer", is a new style of bowling they both invent. Will Anina be able to qualify and make it into the Indian women's team as a bowler, with less than 10 months to go?[10]

Reception[edit]
On the review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes, Ghoomer received a rating of 75%, based on 12 reviews, with an average rating of 6.8/10.[13]
Renuka Vyavahare of The Times of India rated the film 4 stars out of 5 and wrote "A poignant and powerful tale of human resilience".[14] Zee Media Bureau reviewed the film and wrote "Abhishek Bachchan Hits All The Right Chords".[15] In a review, Monika Rawal Kukreja of Hindustan Times wrote "Abhishek Bachchan, Saiyami Kher's stellar acts will move you".[16] Lachmi Deb Roy of Firstpost rated 3 stars out of 5 and wrote "Abhishek Bachchan and Saiyami Kher’s powerful performances will leave you awestruck".[17]
In a review, Toshiro Agarwal of Times Now wrote "Saiyami Kher, Abhishek Bachchan Film Is An Inspiring Journey Of Resilience And Triumph".[18]
Taran Adarsh of Bollywood Hungama awarded the film 2.5/5 stars and wrote "Ghoomer rests on Abhishek Bachchan and Saiyami Kher’s performances and some well-executed scenes. But the narrative is too quick and the trailer ended up showing nearly the whole story."[19]
